alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 14 at 2:09PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Colorado, including the Dinosaur National Monument in Moffat County. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 204 PM MDT, gage reports indicate a rise due to snowmelt. Minor flooding is expected to begin this evening and overnight in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of West Central Moffat County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
